annotation.TEXT: Hello, and welcome to another Touhou flash game: Marippy!
If you approach the upper-left corner of this stage incorrectly, you could end up stuck between a broken floor and an unopenable Master Spark door. If that happens, break the trampoline to escape.
The Master Spark only goes in the direction the knob is on, though a foe coming from the wrong side can still be hit if you time it right.
MAAASTER SPAAARK!!! Some doors have spell circles on them, and they unleash a Master Spark when you open them.

Oh, and another note: I've observed that while Alice is "hugging" an item, she's immune to Master Sparks, so if you have her lined up in your sights at such a time, wait a moment before blasting away!
Whew! Close one! But, as long as I grab the final item, the stage is complete!
Okay, I just earned my second 1-up at 50,000 points...
It's funny how often the enemies will fall through an opening after you've broken one section of weak flooring. Just be careful not to fall for the same trap!
For maximum points, you want to collect the item pairs in this order: The jars of medicine, the books, the brooms, the hats, and then the... uhh... undies.
YES!!! (I knew I'd hit it first!) And I get a nice time bonus too! Now, let's watch the ending...
So, here's how this works: You use left and right to move Marisa, and Z to open and close doors.
Hahaha... Yep, that's the ending! Also, I beat my old high score of 84,810! (Ignore that 64K high score you saw at the beginning. I scored the 84,810 on a different version of this game.)
Now, I'm sure some of you will want me to show you the Game Over screen as well, so...
Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching me play through Marippy! Good bye!
Sweet!
Oh, you know what? I should've shown off breaking a trampoline and falling off the screen here, but I didn't think of it while I was recording. Nuts!
Okay, but I still have two lives left to collect the remaining few items. I can totally do this!
Grab all ten items in a stage to complete it. Also, you'll notice that I'm grabbing items in a particular way.
And, there you go. Now, Alice gets to... uhh... this.
That's three stages done!
So, make sure you pay attention to where the knobs are when you're trying to evade the enemies.
Final stage, and do not start it by going left! That book will have to wait for later.
Now, if an enemy hits you, you lose a life. However, you're safe from them while bouncing on a trampoline. But... The trampolines themselves aren't totally safe.
Nice! I think I clobbered six dolls with that one!

If you bounce on the same trampoline repeatedly without landing on solid ground first, it'll change color from blue to green to yellow to red. If you land on it while it's red, you'll break it and fall through (to your doom in most cases).
Crap! They cleverly cornered me...
Okay, now usually around stage four I decide to forget about going after items in any particular order, and concentrate more on not dying.
Sometimes it's a good idea to close doors behind you. This can help ward off enemies (from one direction at least-- pay attention to where the knob is).
I'm pretty sure the Master Spark hits the entire length of the stage in the direction it's fired, no matter how far off screen it goes.
Gah! That sucks! But, there's just that one book remaining! Can I reach it first?
The enemies get faster and more numerous in later stages, the time limit starts off lower, and the stage layouts get more complex as well.
Now, in addition to collecting the items in pairs for big multipliers, I'll want to collect them in a particular order as well, at least in the early stages.
Wham! And right away I snag an item from Alice's clutches!
Dang it! I hit the side of the ledge at the worst time there!
Alice didn't want to get out of the way for a moment there...
Ah, yes. I should explain the point of this game: You control Marisa and you have to collect all of her belongings while avoiding Alice and her dolls.
Stage 5 introduces a new gimmick. See those darker patches of floor? Those disappear after you cross them, and if you fall into the opening, you'll slam into the floor below and lose a life.
This hat is usually tricky to get, but I have the perfect chance now!
I hesitated slightly in unleashing that Master Spark, because there was a chance that the doll on the other side could've slipped through and killed me if I opened it right away.
Press left or right while you're ascending on a trampoline to get off there, but make sure you line it up right, or you might hit the side of a ledge and fall back down.
Ooh, I just got a 1-up. You get an extra life when your score reaches 20,000 and 50,000 (and maybe 100,000, but I don't know, as I've never scored that high).
Another note on the Master Spark: Any enemies wiped out by one will respawn at the top-center of the stage after a few seconds, so keep that in mind.
Haw, haw!
That was awesome, and I think I caught an off screen enemy in the blast too! The more enemies blasted with a single Master Spark, the more points they're worth!
However, if there's another trampoline (or the final item remaining in the stage) directly below when you break one, you won't die, which might be handy to know later on.
Gotcha! Time it right and you can score Master Spark hits on enemies approaching from the "wrong" side.
Yeah, so that's the whole game. I guess I could briefly show you the manual, and in this version (found on Dagobah), the manual's been translated into English!
Whoa, that was close!
If you collect a pair of the same item in a row, you'll get multiplied points for the second one, and the more you do this in the same stage, the greater the multiplier gets!
However, normal doors still shoot out a star in the direction they open, and any enemies hit by the star will be briefly stunned.
Well, I totally went the wrong way there, but I was hoping that star would stun the doll in front of me. Unfortunately, I think she was still technically airborne at the time...

Also, be careful when you open a Master Spark door. An approaching enemy from the side to be Master Sparked might just slip through without getting hit if she reaches the door just as you open it, which can result in a cheap death.
Also, you can't open doors in midair (but neither can the enemies), so they'll have to be approached from the other side to be opened.
Okay, now back to doors. Doors with spell circles cannot be opened by enemies, but normal doors can, if they approach from the side that doesn't have the knob, so watch out for that.
Alright, stage clear! There are eight stages in all, and each new stage is tougher than the previous one.
That's two stages complete, but they're only going to get harder.
They're going to respawn, so wait until they do, and then... MAAASTER SPAAARK!!!
Oh, and once you land on something solid, weakened trampolines return to their blue color. (However, broken trampolines remain broken unless you lose a life.)

Occasionally, Alice will briefly "hug" one of Marisa's items as she passes by them. If you grab that item at that time, you'll stun Alice and get bonus points. You saw me do this right at the start of stage 1, and I could've done so again right there if I hadn't screwed up!
This game uses the keyboard, although you can use the mouse for the title screen choices. Okay, now let's start the game!

Also, hilariously, any enemies that fall into the revealed holes will also KO themselves, and end up having to respawn. (I guess everybody here can't take falls any better than Mario in the original Donkey Kong could.)

If there are a lot of foes bouncing on the same trampoline as you, and you can afford an extra bounce or two, try waiting to see if they clear out before you get off it yourself. I hate it when I die because a foe got off on the same floor as me.
Each item has a base value, and by starting with the lowest valued items first, I'll get the biggest multipliers for the most valuable items at the end.
I guess I'll create another shortcut here. (Though maybe it would've been faster to go around...)

This one on the left side of stage 5 is a little bugged, though. It doesn't disappear immediately after you cross it if you cross it from the left. This means you might have enough time to backtrack there if you need to.
Okay, get with the program man. That's two deaths already in stage four. I've made it farther than this without dying before!
I think I'm cornered here, but it's just as well, since I probably would've run out of time anyway.
Five down, three to go...
There are these trampolines as well, and you use them to move to different floors. (There's no "jump" button here.)
Come on, dolls, tackle me!
Hahaha... It's fun to do that, but it does waste time, and you lose a life if time runs out. (Though, the points earned can be slightly worth it if you don't time out.)
Maybe I could've reached Alice in time there, but it was risky, so I decided to wait.
Two stages left to go...
Man, why did I have to leave that item for last? I could've Master Sparked a whole bunch of dolls if the stage didn't end there!
Rip! And I just tore that trampoline apart, but since there was another trampoline right below, I'm fine, and it effectively opens up an additional route to use.
